title: ICE: do not use `optimized_mir` for constants: Const   with -Zunpretty=mir-cfg

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
code from glacier fixed/21073.rs ### Code ```Rust const TAG: &'static [u8] = b"ABCD"; fn main() { match &[][..] { TAG => println!("Yes."), _ => println!("No."), } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.52.0-nightly (9b471a3f5 2021-02-19) binary: rustc commit-hash: 9b471a3f5fe57e5c6e08acf665f2094422415a3d commit-date: 2021-02-19 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.52.0-nightly LLVM version: 11.0.1 ``` ### Error output `rustc ./21073.rs -Zunpretty=mir-cfg ` ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'do not use `optimized_mir` for constants: Const', compiler/rustc_mir/src/transform/mod.rs:579:24 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.52.0-nightly (9b471a3f5 2021-02-19) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -Z unpretty=mir-cfg query stack during panic: #0 [optimized_mir] optimizing MIR for `TAG` end of query stack ```
Backtrace
